section.p: You may configure Windows service monitoring for a single service on a single server, a specific service across all Windows servers, or somewhere in between. The Windows Service Monitoring flowchart describes how decides whether a service is monitored, and then, which monitoring template is used to monitor a service.

section.title: Enable or disable monitoring for a single service on a single server

ol.li: Navigate to the service on the server.
Click to select it.
Choose Monitoring from the gear menu.
Choose Yes or No depending on what you want.

section.title: Enable monitoring by default for the WinRM service wherever it is enabled

ol.li: Navigate to Advanced -> Monitoring Templates.
Verify the list of templates is grouped by template.
Expand the WinService tree.
Click once to select the /Server/Microsoft copy.
Choose Copy / Override Template from the gear menu.
Select /Server/Microsoft (Create Copy) from the target list then click submit.
Expand the resulting copy_of_WinService tree.
Select the /Server/Microsoft copy.
Choose View and Edit Details from the gear menu.
Change the template's name to WinRM then click submit.
Double-click to edit the DefaultService' datasource.
Put a check mark in Monitor by Default then click save.

section.title: Enable monitoring by default for the WinRM service for a select group of servers

ol.li: Create a new device class somewhere under /Server/Microsoft/Windows for the select group of servers.
Move the servers to the new device class.
Follow steps 1-5 from the previous section.
Choose your new device class as the target then click submit.
Expand the WinService tree then select the copy in your device class.
Double-click to edit the DefaultService' datasource.
Put a check mark in Monitor by Default then click save.

section.note: For more information about configuring Windows systems, refer to this Knowledge Base article.
